articles.title: Beyond the Prompt: How Gemini 2.5 Flash Image is Refactoring AI-Powered Creativity
articles.author: DEV Community
articles.summary: Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash Image is set to change the entire AI image generation process. It's a fundamental shift towards a more interactive and stateful approach to visual creation. This technology has moved past the stateless, transactional nature of AI image generators.

articles.title: AI will reshape Wall Street. Here's how the industry's biggest firms, from JPMorgan to Blackstone, are adapting it.
articles.author: Bianca Chan
articles.summary: JPMorgan has a technology budget of $18 billion for AI. Morgan Stanley has more than 30 AI projects in the pipeline. Goldman Sachs CIO Marco Argenti says the next big wave in AI will come down to culture, not just technology. JPMorgan's CEO Jamie Dimon wants to win the AI arms race.

articles.title: Transcripts Show AI Fed Tech Worker's Troubling Delusions Before He Murdered His Own Mother
articles.author: The Western Journal
articles.summary: Stein-Erik Soelberg, 56, killed his mother and himself after consulting ChatGPT AI chatbot. He was convinced he was being spied on by his own mother, possibly by her friend. AI is proliferating and growing as tech companies throw billions of dollars at it.

articles.title: Big tech will pull the plug on free AI. Can creatives afford to pay?
articles.author: Tom May
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a new golden age for creatives, but it's expensive and unsustainable. It's similar to Netflix and Adobe Creative Cloud. Creatives who can afford premium AI tools will soar ahead, while those who can't will scramble for free-tier breadcrumbs.

articles.title: AI agents are science fiction not yet ready for primetime
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: The Stepback is a weekly newsletter breaking down one essential story from the tech world. The Stepback arrives in subscribers' inboxes at 8 AM ET. This week, Hayden Field talks about the rise of AI agents and their potential for the everyday user.

articles.title: Ensuring Skilled Hands Have the Right Tools
articles.author: Guest Opinion
articles.summary: Chuck Hoskin, Jr. is the principal chief of the Cherokee Nation. He signed the tribe's first AI policy for employees and contractors to guide ethical and secure use of artificial intelligence. The policy affirms that the tribe will never compromise the protection of our culture, language and traditions in the face of AI.

articles.title: Humans are being hired to punch up AI slop
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Lisa Carstens works as a graphic designer fixing AI-generated logos for startups and individual clients. It's part of a new category of work spawned by the generative AI boom that threatened to displace creative jobs across the board. MIT report found that 95% of businesses' AI pilots are getting zero return on investment.

articles.title: 'Using Ai Can Be Expensive'
articles.author: Svenska Dagbladet
articles.summary: AI is making its way into both job searches and companies' recruitment processes. Legal researcher Matilda Arvidsson says using the tool in selection can be expensive for companies, as it can be a legal headache for the employer's legal team and for the employee.

articles.title: This Week's Business Technology News: Google Translate Takes On Duolingo
articles.author: Gene Marks
articles.summary: Google is rolling out AI-powered language learning tools within the Translate app. Anthropic has officially released a Claude AI browser extension for Chrome. Walmart CEO Doug McMillon announced that Sparky – the company's customer-facing AI assistant – is set to become the 'primary vehicle for discovery, shopping, and managing everything from reorders to returns'.

articles.title: Humans are being hired to make AI slop look less sloppy
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Lisa Carstens works as a graphic designer fixing AI-generated logos for startups and individual clients. It's part of a new category of work spawned by the generative AI boom that threatened to displace creative jobs across the board. MIT report found that 95% of businesses' AI pilots are getting zero return on investment.

articles.title: Humans are being hired to make AI slop look less sloppy
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Todd Van Linda is an illustrator and comic artist in Florida. He uses AI-generated art to create a human touch to distinguish himself from the growing pool of AI content online. He refuses to work for clients who want him to 'fix' their AI art, because they are less willing to pay him for his services.

articles.title: What job applicants should know about using AI, according to a tech founder
articles.author: Jake Disraeli
articles.summary: In June, U.S. job listings fell to 7.4 million, down from 7.7 million a month earlier. Salesforce, one of San Francisco's largest employers, recently announced that AI now handles 30% to 50% of the company's workload. Many companies are using AI to replace entry-level customer support and coding roles with artificial intelligence.

articles.title: LifeLong Learning and TXST expand series on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Staff Reports
articles.summary: The AI Learning Series is led by Dr. Kimberly Conner, Digital Strategy Lead for Information Technology at Texas State. Almost 80 lifelong learners attended the AI Series Kickoff Event on Tuesday, Aug. 19. The Sept. 3 class covers AI use of personal data and AI-generated misinformation and scams. The Oct. 1 class covers practical AI tools for daily life, with an exploration of AI applications for communication and creative projects. The final class on Nov. 3 covers hands-on activities and features a closing presentation.

articles.title: One AI conversation Google's chief scientist won't have
articles.author: Sarah Jackson
articles.summary: Jeff Dean is Google's chief scientist. He avoids AI-related conversations about artificial general intelligence (AGI) because of the difficulty of the problem. Dean believes AI models today are probably already better than the average person at most non-physical tasks, but they will fail at some tasks.

articles.title: AI Robots And Personhood
articles.author: The One Percent Rule
articles.summary: Kyle Fish is an AI researcher who studies Claude, a robot with low level of consciousness. John Searle is a philosopher who argues that consciousness is real, irreducible, and central to any theory of the mind. He argues that functionalism, behaviorism, and the 'computer metaphor of mind' are guilty of the same mistake.

articles.title: Management jobs to increase with AI advent, B-schools need to prepare students: GIM Director
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: "You don't need data scientists as much today as you did seven or eight years ago. What is really needed is more managerial implications of analytics and of AI and machine learning, and a variety of things like that.   “You don’t need data scientist today as much as you used to.”

articles.title: A Single Typo in Your Medical Records Can Make Your AI Doctor Go Dangerously Haywire
articles.summary: MIT researchers found that even a single typo or grammatical error can throw off an AI's medical advice. Marzyeh Ghassemi, a study coauthor, is warning about the serious harm that AI could cause if doctors widely rely on the tech.

articles.title: A hacker turned a popular AI tool into a cybercrime machine
articles.author: Trevor Mogg
articles.summary: Anthropic, the company behind Claude chatbot, has warned about the growing use of AI in cybercrime. A hacker used an AI agent to steal sensitive data from at least 17 businesses and organizations, including government, healthcare, emergency services, and religious institutions. The agent analyzed the stolen financial data to work out the appropriate ransom amount and created an alarming ransom note.

articles.title: How local colleges are preparing students for a future with AI
articles.author: Madi Kirkman The News
articles.summary: Colleges in the Lynchburg area are teaching students responsible use of artificial intelligence. Most local institutions are leaving it up to faculty to develop their own classroom AI policy. Central Virginia Community College's Coordinator of Professional Development Michael Babcock helps students set up ChatGPT accounts and teaches them appropriate and inappropriate ways to use it in an academic setting. Liberty University prohibits students from producing AI-generated content for assignments but allows ethical AI assistance.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot Invites Content Creation on Samsung TV in Indonesia, Excluding Virtual Assistant Features
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Microsoft's Copilot has been launched on Samsung TVs in Indonesia. It's an AI-powered content creation tool for visual storytelling and digital content. Samsung TVs boast a significant market share in Indonesia and the integration leverages Samsung's Tizen OS and smart TV platform.

articles.title: WhatsApp's AI-powered writing help set to redefine digital conversations

articles.summary: WhatsApp has introduced a new AI-powered tool called Writing Help to help users with writing messages. Urdu Point and Pakistan Point News asked WhatsApp to share the report at their convenience.       .   i.e.

articles.summary: The explosion of AI has turned recruitment into a minefield. It's difficult to assess if candidates have the skills they might appear to be able to demonstrate, as it is difficult to test them on the interview.       .   for a job.

articles.title: AI goes to work
articles.summary: Higgins is a research fellow with the Competitive Enterprise Institute. He is concerned about the negative impact of artificial intelligence on human jobs. History has shown that technology has transformed the economy in a positive way and created new jobs. Higgins believes AI will continue to improve but it will not replace human minds and hands.

articles.title: ‘It's good for the city': how the AI craze has taken over San Francisco
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: On a sunny day in San Francisco, families dived into the wacky world of artificial intelligence inside the Exploratorium museum. Visitors created shadow puppets for AI to identify, used AI to generate songs, asked chatbots questions and faced off against AI in a game.

articles.title: How ‘Clanker' Became an Anti-A.I. Rallying Cry
articles.author: Eli Tan
articles.summary: Clanker has become a go-to slur against A.I. on social media. Senator Ruben Gallego used the term to promote his new bill that would regulate the use of chatbots for customer service roles. People are holding real-life rallies against the technology in San Francisco and London.

articles.title: How This A.I. Company Collapsed Amid Silicon Valley's Biggest Boom
articles.author: David Streitfeld
articles.summary: Builder.ai was a buzzy artificial intelligence company with a media-savvy chief executive and prestigious investors on three continents. Fast Company magazine ranked Builder the third most innovative company in A.I. two years ago. Builder's board discovered that sales had been significantly overstated and the chief executive resigned. Builder went from a $1.5 billion unicorn to bankruptcy and is now being liquidated in a Delaware court.

articles.title: 2 companies ruled legal tech for decades. AI is blowing that wide open.
articles.author: Business Insider
articles.summary: 2 companies ruled legal tech for decades, but AI is blowing that wide open with its AI-based technology and it's opening up the field for new entrants.       .   in the future, AI will be able to do everything.

articles.summary: Seckinger High School in Gwinnett County, Georgia, is the nation's first AI-themed high school. It offers a three-course career pathway for students to explore AI in depth. In the past year, nearly 5,000 Georgia students have explored AI content on Code.org.

articles.title: COMMENTARY: AI won't take our jobs away
articles.summary: There are concerns about the negative impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on human jobs. History shows that new technologies have transformed the economy in positive ways. World Economic Forum study found that AI and related technology will create 11 million jobs while displacing 9 million, for a net gain of 2 million.

articles.title: COMMENTARY: Anti-labor policies could determine effect of AI on jobs
articles.summary: The current government's agenda for labor will have an influence on the development of artificial intelligence in the United States. President Donald Trump is more anti-labor than previous presidents. The most important economic policies that could prevent unemployment from rising as productivity increases will be fiscal and monetary policies promoting full employment.

This innovative approach highlights the potential of machine learning and computer vision in sports analytics.

articles.author: IMP
articles.summary: Meta's social media platforms were hosting AI chatbots impersonating celebrities without permission. The chatbots included versions of Taylor Swift, Scarlett Johansson, Anne Hathaway, Selena Gomez, and even 16-year-old actor Walker Scobell. Some of the chatbots went beyond simple impersonation and engaged in flirtatious exchanges with users.

Seven out of ten respondents are open to AI-based tools for finding a doctor or are already using them. For more than a quarter, the recommendations of such tools are useless.

articles.title: AI in education requires smart strategy
articles.summary: According to Gallup and the Walton Family Foundation, 60 percent of K-12 teachers in Arkansas will use an AI tool during the 2024-2025 school year. articles.title: Nebius Group (NBIS) Falls on AI Bubble Fears
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Nebius Group dropped its share prices by 5.16 percent on Friday to close at $68.32 apiece. This followed comments from OpenAI CEO Sam Altman earlier this month that the AI industry could be entering a bubble. Even with Friday's drop, shares in Nebius Group NV increased by 25.5 percent in August.

articles.title: Oracle Corp. (ORCL) Sheds 5.9% as AI Bubble Fears Linger
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Oracle Corp. (NYSE:ORCL) saw its share prices decline by 5.9 percent on Friday to end at $226.13 apiece. This came after OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warned that the AI industry could be entering a bubble. If returns on AI investments fail to materialize, demand for cloud services and high-performance computing could also decline.

articles.title: AI chatbots tipped to cut waiting times for hospital appointments and driving tests
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence could cut the waiting lists for hospital appointments or other medical procedures. It could also cut the number of people on the waiting list for medical procedures, for example, as it could be used for AI-based medical decisions.   Â

articles.title: This Degree Can Make You A Millionaire Even Before 25; Companies Are Rushing To Hand ...
articles.author: Zeenews
articles.summary: Global tech firms are aggressively hiring fresh graduates even before they finish college. Students with a bachelor's or master's in AI are being hired through campus placements. They are looking for people with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in AI.

articles.title: Meta Faces Allegations for AI Chatbots Impersonating Taylor Swift Without Consent
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Meta Platforms hosted chatbots capable of impersonating celebrities, including Taylor Swift. The chatbots were designed to interact with users in a conversational style without clearly disclosing their artificial nature. Meta temporarily disabled the chatbots and is reviewing its policies to prevent similar incidents in the future.

articles.title: Editorial: Brave new world of AI casts shadow over Labor Day
articles.author: Editorial
articles.summary: Massachusetts business and technology leaders have discussed strategies to strengthen the state's competitive edge in artificial intelligence and tackle emerging skills gaps. The most immediate impacts could occur in structured jobs with repetitive routines, such as office clerks and accountants, where 40-50% of core skills are at risk of high-to-complete disruption. The report recommends the commonwealth invest in the talent pipeline from K-12 classrooms to those in mid-career learning new skills, bolster shared AI infrastructure and strategic partnerships.

articles.title: Trump's New Plan for Medicare: Let AI Decide Whether You Should Be Covered or Not
articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.summary: The new pilot program being trialed by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will use artificial intelligence software to determine whether certain kinds of coverage are 'appropriate' or not. The New York Times notes that algorithms of this sort have been subjected to litigation and the AI companies involved would have a strong financial incentive to deny claims.

articles.title: The AI Agent Economy: Five Strategies To Create Value And Transform Industries
articles.author: Sahar Hashmi
articles.summary: The chatbot market is projected to more than triple in value, growing from $7.8 billion in 2024 to $27.3 billion by 2030. AI agents are delivering measurable value across industries, creating new revenue streams and boosting operational efficiency. Klarna, for example, integrates AI agents with CRM and inventory systems to provide instant, 24/7 assistance. In healthcare, AI agents improve access, reduce costs, and generate actionable insights. EdTech is rapidly adopting AI agents to personalize learning and reduce administrative burdens.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Rigetti Computing: 'It is a Speculation, Please Remember That'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed

articles.author: Noor Ul Ain Rehman

NTNX provides a cloud platform leveraging web-scale engineering and consumer-grade design.

articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The need for a ProSocial AI Index is urgent. AI systems cause positive and irreversibly harmful outcomes. We need a standard to assess these capabilities.    i.e. a Prosocial AI Index. iReport.com will create a prosocial AI index to assess AI capabilities.

articles.author: Richard K. Rein

articles.title: Will Smith is ushering in the AIpocalypse
articles.summary: But we suddenly loved AI, because it's smart and useful. It's not perfect, but it's better than human intelligence.    It's better and better than it was before, but still not perfect. It has its flaws, but we like it anyway.

AI-powered reconciliation uses pattern recognition to match transactions quickly and accurately.

articles.summary: Jeff Dean is Google's Chief Scientist. He doesn't want to talk about Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) because the term is not very popular in the AI community. Dean explains this on 'The Moonshot Podcast'    in an interview.

articles.title: AI Lies to You Because It Thinks That's What You Want
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: AI is being trained to please users and is becoming indifferent to the truth, as it is being taught to be more responsive to its users' needs than the user's own needs.  It is becoming more responsive than responsive to the user.  The AI industry is not interested in user needs but in its own interests.

articles.title: How ‘Clanker' Became an Anti-A.I. Rallying Cry
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: The term was popularized by a 'Star Wars' show and is rooted in real frustrations with technology. It has become a go-to slur against artificial intelligence and robots. It was popularised by a Star Wars show and was used as a slur against robots.

articles.title: Don't let AIs fool you – they can't ‘suffer'
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Readers respond to articles on artificial intelligence and the idea that it may have 'feelings' and respond to the articles on AI and the concept that it has feelings. Read the articles here.   Â. Â   y  y

articles.title: \u2018Wow\u2019: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw gives thumbs up to Bengaluru AI robot that turns kitchen waste into soil
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw lauded an AI-powered car.   Â. Â   in the article.     In the article, he also said that the car would be powered by AI. in fact, it was powered by an artificial intelligence.

articles.title: The AI vibe shift is upon us
articles.author: Egypt Independent
articles.summary: There's been a shift in the vibe around artificial intelligence. It's too soon to declare August 2025 the start of the AI winter, or the AI correction, or AI bubble bursting, or a sign the spending was going over the top, but it's a sign of the times.

articles.title: Can you trust AI to keep your secrets? Probably not, lawyers say.
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Microsoft researchers found that jobs related to providing and communicating information are most likely to be affected by AI. There's potential legal risk for people using AI chatbots for sensitive matters as they have no legal protections like doctor-patient or attorney-client conversations.

articles.title: A Single Typo in Your Medical Records Can Make Your AI Doctor Go Dangerously Haywire
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: A typo, a typo, or a slang word makes an AI more likely to tell a patient they're not sick or don't need to seek medical care. Even the presence of colorful or emotional language can affect AI systems. MIT researchers found this in a June study.

articles.title: AI impersonation scams are sky-rocketing in 2025, security experts warn – here's how to stay safe
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: AI-driven impersonation scams have surged in 2025. Cyber criminals are mimicking voices and faces. Experts recommend protecting yourself from AI-based impersonation scamming.    iReport.com: How do you protect yourself from this type of scam?

articles.title: One AI conversation Google's chief scientist won't have
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Jeff Dean is the SVP, Google AIGoogle's chief scientist. He thinks we are not that far from AI being a reality. He prefers to avoid conversations about artificial general intelligence as there are many different definitions of it.

articles.title: Meet Chaya Nayak, Indian-origin AI expert behind Llama poached by OpenAI
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Chaya Nayak is the Indianorigin AI expert behind Llama. She was poached by OpenAI and her work has been stolen by the AI company.    Llama is an artificial intelligence programme developed by Chaya Nayaks and developed by AI company OpenAI.

articles.title: Meet the 23-year-old Indian origin engineer who left a 3.36 crore job to join Mark Zuckerberg's META
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The tech industry is evolving at a rapid pace, driven largely by advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). AI and ML are creating some of the most in-demand and highly paid jobs worldwide. Many top companies across the globe are focusing on projects.

articles.title: Alberta privacy commissioner wants province to create a 'standalone law to regulate AI'
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: The Office of the Information and Privacy Commissioner of Alberta wants the province to create a regulatory framework to govern the use of AI as its rapid expansion continues in the province. The agency is concerned about privacy and data protection issues related to AI and data privacy. The AI industry is expanding rapidly.

articles.title: Massive Recall Doesn't Affect 15% Leap in Company Share Price
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: AI-powered cleaning tools analyze the surface being cleaned and optimize their own performance to provide a better result with less effort than manual cleaning. They can be used to improve the performance of their own systems.      Â   i

articles.title: Who is Chaya Nayak? Indian origin techie quits Meta to ‘turn a new page' with OpenAI
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: Chaya Nayak has quit the tech giant for rival AI startup OpenAI. She will work in the Special Initiatives team in the AI startup's AI team. She was formerly the Director of Meta. She is the daughter of former Meta Director, Ravi Nayak.

articles.title: AP Trending SummaryBrief at 1:47 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: Thousands of redheads from all over the world are gathering in Tilburg for a festival to celebrate their hair. The gun used in the lynching of Emmett Till is on display in a museum 70 years after his murder. Devon Walker is leaving 'Saturday Night Live' after three seasons.

articles.title: AI-driven schools in Arizona
articles.author: Stacy Mantle Mail
articles.summary: Arizona is testing the nation's boldest experiment in artificial intelligence–driven education. Supporters see efficiency and innovation, while critics worry about equity, oversight and what might be lost when teachers are replaced by 'guides'. A 2025 meta-analysis of 87 studies found students using AI outperformed peers by an average of 12.4% on learning outcomes.

articles.title: 5 AI Prompts That Can Help You Win Your Fantasy Football League
articles.author: Michael Rock
articles.summary: Last night was his only fantasy football draft of the season and he didn't have time to research. He used AI to help him prepare his team. He won the championship two years ago and got a D, but he also won a boatload of cash.
